speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The Voice Design engine, marked in blue, is where you can invent new speakers. In this tab, you are not directing a pre-trained actor; you are creating one from imagination.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: This process uses two distinct prompts. The first is the Voice Description. This describes the physical, consistent qualities of the speaker.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: Think of attributes like age, gender, accent, and vocal texture. For example, 'An elderly male with a deep, gravelly voice and a British accent'.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The second prompt is the Style Instruction, which works just like it does in the Custom Voice tab. This defines the speaker's current emotional state and performance.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: The A I combines these two pieces of information to generate a unique voice. The results can be surprising, so feel free to experiment with creative combinations.

speaker: Tutorial Wizard
text: In our next chapter, we will focus on the art of writing effective descriptions for this engine. Please load chapter seven.
